qas.question: What holy document takes the view of Mary back to the creation of man and woman ?

answers.text: papal bull defining the dogma, Ineffabilis Deus

qas.question: What specific part the Bible does this document reference for Mary ?
According to the document what did the forebears already have knowledge of before Mary came about ?

answers.text: the Fathers saw foreshadowings of Mary's "wondrous abundance of divine gifts and original innocence

qas.question: Where was Mary represented (according to the Holy document ) on the vessel that wandered the sea for forty days and forty nights ?

answers.text: in that ark of Noah, which was built by divine command and escaped entirely safe and sound from the common shipwreck of the whole world

plausible_answers.text: The papal bull defining the dogma, Ineffabilis Deus

qas.question: What holy document says Mary was present in Eden?
Who would Mary never be completely triumphant over?

plausible_answers.text: Mary's "wondrous abundance of divine gifts and original innocence"

qas.question: What did God have foreshading of?
What did Moses see from earth to heaven?

context: <b4_0>The <a0_0>papal bull defining the dogma, Ineffabilis Deus<b4_0/><a0_0/>, mentioned in particular the patrististic interpretation of <a1_0>Genesis 3:15<a1_0/> as referring to a woman, Mary, who would be eternally at enmity with <b5_0>the evil serpent<b5_0/> and completely triumphing over him. It said <a2_0>the Fathers saw foreshadowings of <b6_0>Mary's "wondrous abundance of divine gifts and original innocence<a2_0/>"<b6_0/> "<a3_0>in that ark of Noah, which was built by divine command and escaped entirely safe and sound from the common shipwreck of the whole world<a3_0/>; in the <b7_0>ladder<b7_0/> which Jacob saw reaching from the earth to heaven, by whose rungs the angels of God ascended and descended, and on whose top the Lord himself leaned; in that bush which Moses saw in the holy place burning on all sides, which was not consumed or injured in any way but grew green and blossomed beautifully; in that impregnable tower before the enemy, from which hung a thousand bucklers and all the armor of the strong; in that garden enclosed on all sides, which cannot be violated or corrupted by any deceitful plots; in that resplendent city of God, which has its foundations on the holy mountains; in that most august temple of God, which, radiant with divine splendours, is full of the glory of God; and in very many other biblical types of this kind."
